frameDefinitions: A Useful_location is accessible to some (possibly generic)
A New filler occupies a Role or serves a Function after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
An Entity has a Temperature characterized by the target.

A Financial_instrument (a bond or insurance) fulfills a condition at a certain Time after which the Issuer of the Financial_instrument is legally obligated to pay the Holder a monetary Value, based on the instrument's original Principle and the Interest rate.
In this frame an Abuser repeatedly treats the Victim in a cruel and violent way, including physically harming or forcing the Victim to engage in sexual activity against their will.
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
frameExamples: I left the door to the lobby <t>open</t> for you.
The pan is already too <t>hot</t> to touch.
The bond had <t>matured</t> to its full value at 30 years.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.
An entity that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Useful_location</fen> is or is not accessible.
The new filler of the <fen>Role</fen> that was previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen> filler.
The category that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities fit into as a result of the <fen>Function</fen> they serve.
The (generally desirable) state of affairs that the <fen>New</fen> and <fen>Old</fen> entities are involved in bringing about.
The entity that occupied the <fen>Role</fen> or served the <fen>Function</fen> before the <fen>New</fen> filler.
The time at which the <fen>New</fen> takes up the <fen>Role</fen> previously occupied by the <fen>Old</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen> is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Temperature</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having  a particular <fen>Degree</fen> for the temperature <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The bond, insurance, or debt security which a Holder buys from an Issuer.
When the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> reaches maturity.
The <fen>Abuser</fen> subjects the <fen>Victim</fen> to repeated verbal, physical, emotional or sexual attacks.
The <fen>Victim</fen> is the recipient of the <fen>Abuser</fen>'s actions.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the abuse occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the abuse occurs.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
listRoleExamples: The traditional thatched roof has often been replaced <fex>by corrugated galvanized iron</fex>.
What gas replaced Hydrogen <fex>as a safer medium for use in balloons</fex> on account it does not burn?
Oil and gas replaced coal <fex>in heating homes, in industry, and in transportation</fex>.
The electron was discovered and <fex>electricity</fex> replaced gas lamps.
When electricity replaced oil <fex>in the early 1930's</fex>, the steady beam was replaced by a flashing light.
The skillet had a temperature <fex>of 230 F</fex>
<fex>Fred</fex> abused Martha by locking her into a closet .
Fred abused <fex>Martha</fex> by locking her into a closet .
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
